message_1: What is the GCD of 150 and 225?
message_2:
The GCD (Greatest Common Divisor) of 150 and 225 can be found using the Euclidean algorithm or by factoring the numbers and finding the highest common factor.

Factoring method:
150 = 2 × 3 × 5²
225 = 3² × 5²

The common factors are 3 and 5². Multiplying these common factors gives the GCD:

GCD(150, 225) = 3 × 5² = 3 × 25 = 75
